bibl.note: This is a letter dated June 16, 1838 from James King to his son, Henry King. He praises his son for his achievements as a volunteer in the army and is grateful for the letters Henry has written to him. He urges him to write with more information on army movements and other inside information.

address.addrLine: Coln Henderson Yoakum For Henry A.J. King Koss Lauding E Tenn

div1.p:
I received yours of the 4th Instant and was pleased to here that you William & Abert enjoyed good health, as well as that of the company, I was also pleased with the diction of your letter, giving the general transactions and and movements of the army, Your friends and neighbours makes much enquireay about you, and are highly gratified to here from you, I received a letter from Coln Yoakum speaking very highly of you boys, I also saw a his letter to your Uncle Jamison speaking of you, he also had reference to the letter I rote you, responding approving of it very highly from such sorses of impressions I feel highly gratified gratified, and hope that I shall not be disappointed in you, as nor the rest of the volenteers of our company in their ready willingness to purform their duties, and act the part of prudent highminded and honourably soaldiers, My former letter I wish you to preserve and bear in mind its contents, _ I saw Majr Beshares, he informed me he become acquainted with you and eat several times in your mess and that you requested him to let me know how you ware he informed me you and Albert ware in a mess with Capt Cocks and two Mr Landers, but did'nt recollect who else I have no doubt but Cocks is first rate mismate
and I understand Mr sander's are very respectible men, it is very importent to have an agreeably mess no other I wouldend stay in, therefore you must act the prudent part, then, their will be no difficulty in being taken in any where, I wish not to be understood, as incinuating that you are not in an agreeably mess, but on the contrary I hope their is no others but agreeably ones, when you rite let me know who are your mesmates, let me know what has been the principal regulations of the army what you are generally imployed about, What number of Indians are come in and sent off and their willingness whether the indians on the North Carolina side are coming in or not, or incline hostile, and any thing else that you may think interesting, tel the Ransoms I saw their father yesterday they ware all well; tel Bright Snell I stayed with his father thirsday night left in the morning 15 Instant, he is quite delarious knows no body, he cant live long many days, the rest of his children ware all there and well, Your uncle Ganoways & Jamisons family are all well, also the rest of your friends and connection Thos Turner was married to Miss Litton on Wednesday the 6th Inst
The examination ended on yesterday at Salem Academa We are now out of teachers, Mr Jones & Russworm does not teach their the next session,

p.del: Myself Your Mother Brother & Sister are all well and Joines me in love and well wishes for your William & Aberts prosperity & return,

div1.p: My respects to Coln Yoakum Majr Molloy, Capt Macklin Maclin, and Officers, and to all the company
Myself Your mother Brothers & sisters cousin Sarah & martha are all well, and Joines me in love and well wishes for yours Williams & Aberts prosperity and return -
